title: Google Mourns Veteran Engineer Luiz André Barroso Who Invented the Modern Data Center
description: Brazilian engineer Luiz André Barroso, who ripped up the rulebook at Google, has died. His radical ideas for data centers laid the foundations for cloud computing.

title: Enough Talk, ChatGPT—My New Chatbot Friend Can Get Things Done
description: An experimental AI assistant called Auto-GPT can use the web to solve problems. When the automated helper works, it can feel like the future.

title: Meet the Law Geeks Exposing Google’s Secretive Antitrust Trial
description: A historic antitrust trial sees Google accused of unlawfully monopolizing search. A handful of antitrust activists are trying to make sure the world sees all the action.

title: How Elon Musk and Tesla Helped Spark the UAW Auto Strikes
description: Tesla isn’t involved in the strike at Detroit’s Big Three automakers. But the EV maker and its irrepressible CEO had plenty to do with why the walkouts happened.

title: Palantir’s Reputation Stalks Its Bid for the UK’s National Health Data
description: US-based Palantir is favored to win a $595 million NHS contract, but activists and doctors worry about its controversial ties to cofounder Peter Thiel, the military, and US border control.
